meanings.definition: Transfer from public to private ownership or control.
meanings.sent1: The government privatizes the state-owned companies.
meanings.sent2: The city council decided to privatize the public transportation system.
meanings.sent3: The magician privatizes the rabbit, making it disappear into thin air!
meanings.sent4: She privatizes the classroom, turning it into her own cozy study space.
meanings.sent5: The sun privatizes the sky, painting it with vibrant colors at sunset.

meanings.definition: Cause to become private or owned by a private individual or company.
meanings.sent1: The company privatizes its operations to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The new law will privatize the management of the national parks.
meanings.sent3: The chef privatizes the recipe, keeping it a secret from everyone.
meanings.sent4: His smile privatizes his face, making it light up with joy.
meanings.sent5: The music privatizes the room, filling it with soothing melodies.
